text:
We are a cloud native
integration platform.

And so we use all of the
different compute

and other primitives to build
and operate our service.

And then that comes with the
need to be able to observe

and understand the
performance and the uptime
and the availability and optimize
that over time for our customers,

Amazon CloudWatch Container
Insights is a big part
of being able to launch, iterate services

and being able to understand
their performance envelope
and characteristics.
We can get very granular insights down
to the individual container level

and do that directly in the
dashboards that we have.

Specifically, we have a component
that is called SnapGPT
for developers, helps them build faster.
That requires us to be able

to scale very fast potentially
if something takes off,

to move resources around
in response to demand.

So one of our customers in
Europe had a really interesting
experience with their generative AI.

They had a major problem
with contract mismatches
between the contracts their customers had
and what their internal systems had.
And in some cases there was a mismatch
and they were losing money.
And with SnapLogic, our capabilities,
our generative integration capabilities,

using Amazon Bedrock,
literally in a day we're able

to deliver a completed
project that is on track

to save them tens of
millions of euro of revenue
that they were otherwise losing.
